intro: Nauclea tenuis, commonly known as the slender nauclea, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, often woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, capsule-like fruits. Nauclea tenuis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems it inhabits.
